intro: Milleria glandulosa, commonly known as the glandular milleria, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Milleria glandulosa is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
